etymologies: late 17th century: from French, from Old French argot ‘cock's spur’ (because of the appearance produced by the disease)

definitions: a fungal disease of rye and other cereals in which black elongated fruiting bodies grow in the ears of the cereal. Eating contaminated food can result in ergotism.

notes.text: The fungus is Claviceps purpurea, subdivision Ascomycotina

shortDefinitions: fungal disease of rye and other cereals in which black elongated fruiting bodies grow in ears of cereal

definitions: the fruiting bodies of ergot, used as a source of certain medicinal alkaloids, especially for inducing uterine contractions or controlling postpartum bleeding.
shortDefinitions: fruiting bodies of ergot fungus, used as source of certain medicinal alkaloids

definitions: a small horny protuberance on the back of each of a horse's fetlocks.
shortDefinitions: small horny protuberance on back of each of horse's fetlocks
